The world is like water in the canoe. Water that stays in the boat moves with the pulling of the oars. Progress and recession alternate during our lives.
The world is like the [swinging] of the testicles of the he-goat.

text: Dunia ni mduara, huzunguka kama pia.
explanation: The earth is round, it goes like a top. There are ups and downs.

text: Dunia ni nyumba ya mtu asiye na nyumba.
explanation: The world is a dwelling place for the one who has no house.
The earth is people. People make the earth either good or bad.
The world is nothing, depend not on it.
The world is a market of many things.
The earth is like an old rag. The earth is full of dirty things and various kinds of struggle tear it to pieces.

Let's not make this a world of the file. A file is used to grind another by friction. The life of the file is one in which the stronger oppresses the weaker. This means that we should not turn our life here on earth to be one of causing inconvenience to each other.
Don't fight the world.

text: Dunia ya mungu, watu wa serikale.
explanation: The world belongs to God, the people belong to the government.
There is nothing in the world that does not cause vexation to a person.
In the world, good acts kill.

text: Dunyani hupiga kura, peponi mna kudura.
explanation: In this world people draw lots, [but our place] in Paradise [is assured, if we have been just,] by God's power and providence.
The delusions of this world, one usually knows them in hell. But then it is too late.
History does not change. It repeats itself.
The sun never goes down without some happenings.
The sun never goes down without a happening.

text: Jua linakuchwa katika dola ya mngereza sasa.
explanation: Now the sun goes under in the empire of the Englishman. In contradiction to the saying during Elizabeth I: The sun does not set in the British Empire.

text: Katika ulimwengu "he" ni nne tu, zimeondoka mbili, na mbili zimesalia: "haya" hakuna na "huruma" hakuna, zimesalia "hila na 'hadhaa'.
explanation: In the world there are only four "aitches" [h's]: two are gone and two are left behind; modesty and mercy are not more, there remain cunning and deceit. A lament of the nineteenth century.
What happens on earth does not lack being heard.
What goes on on earth does not hide itself, it will be revealed.
European lifestyle turns one's head; the world constantly changes. The world is unstable. Urban life is deceitful.

text: Kuibeba dunia usiifunge kwa kambe isije ikakuangusha na kukulemea.
explanation: If you must carry the world, don't tie it with a rope because it might fall upon you and oppress you. Overly involvement. Worries.
Weep and then be silent, that's the world. There is a time for sorrow, but once it is over, one should attend to other duties.
The natural condition does not change. Nature does not change.
The world is a mixture of good and evil.

text: Ulimwengu kigeugeu leo ulale katikati, kesho kando.
explanation: The world is fickle, today you may sleep in the middle, and tomorrow on the edge.

text: Ulimwengu ni dhaifu, siumboneni, ni cheche.
explanation: The world is a weak thing, don't take it into consideration, it is like a spark.
The world is ashes.
The world is like empty words, if you pursue them you'll be lost. One must have solid principles.

text: Ulimwengu ni mema na mabaya pamoja.
explanation: The world is full of good and bad things together.

text: Ulimwengu ni muovu, mtu hajetei nao.
explanation: The world is evil, one should not depend on it. For more of the same, see proverbs in this section beginning with

text: Ulimwengu ni ngwe mbovu, mtu hajetei nao.
explanation: The world is like rotten rope: no person trusts it.
The world is a school for fools. Cf. #418
The things of the world go to the brave, the earth deceives.

text: Ulimwengu umemshinda kaa, endaye upande upande.
explanation: The world is too much for the crab, it goes sideways. There is no need to enter all kinds of dangers blindly, just for the sake of showing off. The world has even defeated the crab which moves sideways, i.e., moving with glamor and exultation of a proud creature.
In the world there are not two things that [really] love each other. Cf. #653.
Don't be deceived by the world.
